meanings.definition: In a way that provides a wide and comprehensive view.
meanings.sent1: She looked around panoramically, taking in the entire landscape.
meanings.sent2: The camera captured the scene panoramically, showing every detail.
meanings.sent3: He tried to read the tiny text on the sign, but only saw it panoramically.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked panoramically, considering all possibilities at once.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the mural panoramically, covering the entire wall with colors.

meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a panorama.
meanings.sent1: The painting had a panoramically beautiful view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The theater had a panoramically curved screen for an immersive experience.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated panoramically, with a scene from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: His imagination was as vast and panoramically detailed as a panoramic photo.
meanings.sent5: The new TV had a panoramically wide display, perfect for watching movies.
